remarks: Given the hypotheses of the Weierstrass M-test, the convergent function of the sequence is uniformly bounded.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2017.)
statement:
mtest.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` N ) $.
mtest.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. ZZ ) $.
mtest.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
mtest.f $e |- ( ph -> F : Z --> ( CC ^m S ) ) $.
mtest.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. W ) $.
mtest.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( M ` k ) e. RR ) $.
mtest.l $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( k e. Z /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( abs ` ( ( F ` k ) ` z ) ) <_ ( M ` k ) ) $.
mtest.d $e |- ( ph -> seq N ( + , M ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
mtest.t $e |- ( ph -> seq N ( oF + , F ) ( ~~>u ` S ) T ) $.
mtestbdd $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. RR A. z e. S ( abs ` ( T ` z ) ) <_ x ) $.
$d F k x z $.
$d M k x z $.
$d N k x z $.
$d S k x z $.
$d T x z $.
$d Z k x z $.
$d k ph x z $.
